text: 750 ml bottle from phaleslu. Thanks! The beer is a glowing gold with a white head of foam. The aroma has notes of apricot, wood, vanilla, tropical fruits. Sour and fruity for days. Strong stone fruit. Medium body and medium carbonation. Beautiful beer. Thanks again Pedro.

Keg at Ratebeer Best Beer Festival. 31/01/2016. As blend 3. A hazed yellow, golden coloured pour with a lasting thin white head. Aroma is nice fresh saison yeat, lemon rind, straw. Flavour is composed of tart lemon citrus, lemon rind, straw grains, light grains. Palate is refreshing , tart, highish carbonation.

Pours golden orange with a fast fading white head. Aroma is mildly funky with a moderate orange pulp backbone. Flavor starts with a punch of citric acid that fades to a moderate tartness. Finishes with a mild barnyard flavor. Aftertaste is a lingering tartness. Delicious but the tartness masks the saison qualities a lot.
Blend 1 bottle thanks to Russell. Pours hazy orange with no head. Orange zest. Mild sourness.

Bottle shared at Deans last Stand.
Medium creamy white head. Cloudy blond pour. Very refreshing.

Bottle from my buddy Vince, thanks man!!!! Hung onto this for a while. Pours orange with a soft white head. Funk and wine dominate the nose. Taste is light sour, brett, wine barrel. Flavors blend seamlessly. Incredibly easy to drink. This is about as good as a saison gets for me.
CBC2015, Pours orange to yellow with a small head, aroma of brett, sulfur, vinegar, great, flavor is sour with brett, sulfur and vinegar, medium, very nice

Sampled at the RateBeer Best fest 2016. Pours clear yellow with a creamy, white head. The nose holds lemon and peach. Light sweet flavour, moderately acidic, with lemon Smarties, light tang, wheat, hay. Light bodied with average carbonation. Clean and tart on the finish, with more lemony character, dry pale bread, light funk. Great beer.
Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Golden shade with a lasting fluffy head. Smells wild and floral. Taste is lightly tart and very refreshing. Not mindblowing but very tasty.

Tap at CBC 2016, Yellow session. Aroma of citrus, lemon and grapes. Zesty. Notes of brett and light lactic. Wooden notes. The flavour is mainly sour, but very balanced with mild sweetnees and bitterness. A good one...
From tap at CBC 2016. It pours clear golden with a white head. The aroma is light sourish with brett and fruity hops. The flavor is sour and light bitter. Oak and grapefruit zest.
A hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of straw, lemons, and some funk. The flavor is sour with notes of straw, citrus fruits, and funk, leading to a tart finish.
On tap at RateBeer Best 2016. Pour is hazy orange/yellow with a minimal white head. Aroma and flavor of light citrus funk, white grapes, green apples, and straw.

750, capped. Thanks, S! Pours a cloudy pale gold with a sudsy loose white head. Lightly funky straw, wet grass, floral, cream, and soft candied lemon nose. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Straw, green apples, white wine grapes, sweet cream, and candied lemon on the mid palate. Long mildly funky finish. Wonderful saison.

Good barrel aged saison but this brewery continues to fall a little short of the top saison breweries. Hazy straw color with light white head. Aroma is oak, funk, pineapple, dough and cheese. Taste is funky tart and a bit too doughy sweet. Overall nice but the sweetness detracts.
UPDATED: FEB 8, 2016 Tap at the Rate Beer Awards Festival. Deep gold with lace. Rich fruity nose, grapefruit, brett, leather. Crisp, tart flavor, lovely grapefruit and lemon, some leather. Great.

Sample at RateBeer best 2015. Pours hazy golden orange, small off-white head with good lacing. Aroma is oaky, floral, stonefruit and brett, plus a mineraly note. Flavor is light plus tart, lightly funky, fairly minerally, reminiscent of HF. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Grate.
Taster at Ratebeer best. Pours a golden color with a bit of head. Blend 3. Perfect amount of funk and sour. Citrusy.

batch 3 bottle shared with a friend. poured a beatiful murky deep yellow golden colour with a nice white head on top. nose is incredible and unique in its style. a nice clear funky brett aroma in the nose, dusty, and crisp malts, the wine oak and a nice subtle sweet aroma, combined with sweet white grapes chardonnay, yeast, lemon pulp, and sweet green melon. theres a slight tartness of funk in the aftertaste. I was expecting more to be honost. but the balance is on of a kind, with no alcohol notice. with a nice clean dry finish. one of the better beers in its style. fantastic beer by SP, had to come back at my rating after ive cracked the fruited versions

On tap at CBC15. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma is citrus, yeast, barrel notes, saison esters, light berries, funk and herbal notes. Taste is malty, dry, grain dust, saison yeast, fruit, grapes and wood.

Draught @ CBC2015. Pours hazy vibrant deel yellow with a big frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick lacing on the glass. Smell is fruity and funky with crackers, lemonade, white grapes, hay, dry soil, minerals, barnyard and lemon zest. Taste is sour, fruity and slightly funky. Mouthfeel is sparkling, dry, tart and light to medium bodied. Finish is sour with crackers, lemon juice, lime juice, white grapes, hay, dry soil, minerals, barnyard and lemon zest. Good stuff but much of the complex funk is hidden behind heavy citric acidity.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ (Blue session). Hazy golden colour with a small white head, that leaves some lace. Aroma is citrus, some yeast, mild berries, a bit funkiness as well as some herbal notes. Flavour is fruity, floral, some berries, mild wood and floral notes.

May 1, 2015. On tap at CBC2015, blue session. 
Hazy pale orange with small white head. Aroma is citrus, grapes, oak, brett, white wine, spicy yeast notes. Taste is tart, dry, light sweet, vinous. Finish is tart fruity with lemon, apple and grape skins, light sweetness, dry oak and wine notes. Light to medium bodied, dry and crisp, average carbonation. 

Very nice refreshing BA saison

750 mL bottle. Originally reviewed 11/7/2014.
Hazy bright orange. Nice white head. Medium collar and nice lacing.

White wine aroma is strong. Orange and lemon acidity. Some tropical fruits. A little oak.

Taste is oak and a nice wine barrel presence. Hefty malt. A bit of stone fruit. A little astringent. Light tartness, kinda lemony.

Medium body. Very light tartness. Medium low carbonation.

Im going to sound overly critical here, so I only say this in comparison to the best of wine barrel saisons. This is just a little too sweet and malty to compare. Still a great beer, but doesnt quite compare.
Bottle batch #2 and #3 ....Pour is golden with a white head...Nose is funk, spice, honey, citrus, bugs, oak...Taste is cobwebs, spice, oak, musty, wine oak,

(750ml bottle) cloudy gold body, fine offwhite bubbles. Nose of heavy Chardonnay, medium tartness, saison yeast, dry grapes, juicy fruit, oak, and grape must. Taste of medium Chardonnay, dry grapes, oak, very tart but not really sour, Brett in the back, and super carbonated. The high carb takes Away from it slightly.
From tap at CBC 2015. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, barnyard, brettanomyces, spice, oak and tartness.

Bottle shared by John. Thanks!

A: Cloudy straw color with a thin white head.

N: White peppercorn, straw, grapefruit rind, lemon zest, some pineapple and mango, white wine grape, and oak.

T: Tart and a bit sweet. Doesnt devolve into sweet-tarts, though. (Thankfully).

M: Light body, crisp carbonation, no alcohol presence.

O: Another winner from Perennial. A bit too easy to take this one down.
750 ml bottle thanks to John. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a large white head. A big fruity lemon nose. Bready, lemons, zesty, bready, citrus. Sharp.
25.4oz bottle. Cloudy straw color. Dry grassy nose. A smooth sour. Tangy citrus with sweet & sour notes. Medium+ body and carbonation.

CBC 2015. Pours hazy golden with a low white head. Aromas of funk, citrus, orange, farmhouse and gooseberry. Taste is funk and citrus upfront with notes of gooseberry and farmhouse muskiness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very good!

Draft at FOFA, One of the best of the event for me. Pours golden orange with medium white lacing. Aroma and flavor are lemon and sour grape funk, lacto and plenty of Brett complexities, wet oak, peach, and light barn. Perfect amount of tartness and flavor in the finish. Excellent.

Sampled at FOFA15 with Linh, Paul, Vin and Al. Pours a deep hazy orange with thick, active white lacing. Mouthfeel is essentially perfectly balanced between tart fruits, sour oak, and faint mineral character. Incredibly tart and beautifully sour with the funkiness perfectly controlled. Marvelous sour saison and one of the best offerings of the festival.

Bottle share @ Cycle, St. Pete, thanks Glen.
Dorée sur un léger trouble, col épais blanc.
Arôme au bouquet distinct de brett, rétro fruité avec de belles notes de vin blanc et fin épicé du boisé.
Palais offre un léger profil aigre-brett, fizzy carb, fruité sur la fin avec un côté barrique de vin Chardonnay, rustique sans vraiment tomber sans le style belge avec une fin légèrement citrique Reste cependant grandement influencé par le côte farmhouse américain.
Combo rating of batch 1,2 and 3. Nice yellow pour with a heavy white head. Batch 1 and 3 are flat at another level. Taste is tart, peach and some nice white wine character. Flat out awesome!
Tap at CBC 2015. Hazy orange color, small white head. Fruity, tart aroma. Medium-bodied. Tart, fruity, grspes flavor. Nicely in balance. Wineous. Nice one, alcohol hits in the aftertaste.
Golden pour. Nose is chardonnay barrel, butter, brett. Taste is wine barrel, acidic, lacto.

CBC as Side Project Saison du Fermier Blend #2. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, saison yeast and fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. Slightly acidic. 010515

CBC as "Saison du Fermier Blend #2". Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is maltfruit, baking yeast, lemon, tart, spices and yeast. Flavour is malt, yeast, spices, lemon, baking yeast, lemon, tart, little sweet, medium dry and a little bitter.

Bottle to glass. Pours a murky deep yellow light orange color with an off white head. Aroma is a nice tartness, citrus, barnyard funk. Flavor packs a pretty solid sour, more than expected. Lingering tartness and funk in the finish. Excellent beer.

Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours hazy dark yellow with a white head, lacings. Aroma of malt, yeast, grass, flowers, light sourness, light citrus. Flavor is light sour, malt, grain, grass, flowers, little citrus, Medium body, lively carbonation. Nice and refreshing. 010515

Tasted on tap in a stemmed wine glass at Side Project Cellar as "Saison du Fermier Blend #3". It poured an attractive light orange amber, slight haze (but much less murky than their Foedre Beer), with sudsy, long-lasting white foam and Belgian lace. Grainy and lemony, tart and acidic, definitely heading into sour territory, yogurty lacto bite, young Brett earthiness but I couldnt detect any aged brett characteristics, nor any wood essence, sadly. Extremely light residual malty sweetness. Light body, strong carbonation, crisp and spritzy mouthfeel, lingering aftertaste big on wacky fermentation notes. Very tasty and complex saison.

~3 oz sample at the Boulevardia Taps & Tastes in Kansas City, Missouri. The pour is slight haze golden, decent white head considering the size of pour. The aroma is lemon citrus, fresh grass / hay, additional citrus fruit and soft earthy yeast presence. Bunch going on the nose, clean and fresh. The taste is tart lemon, lacto and Brett, the grass and hay of the nose and finishing cleanly. Wine and barrel were not all that present.  The palate is medium bodied, active carbonation and a clean, softly funk yeast finish. Happy to have tried this one, though certainly left me wanting for more.

Keg at the 4th Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Session 2, 01/05/2015. 
Very lightly hazed golden orange with a decent off white cap.
Nose is tarte citric, grape must, dank wood tones, straw, funk, light spice.
Taste comprises light tropical fruit, funky notes, bitter citric peel, straw, earthy, sour fruit, lactic twinge.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid funky saison, subtle barreling.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draft to stemmed wine glass. Blend #3. Looks good; a milky apricot with white head. Smells of semi-sweet and mildly tart with notes of saison yeast, brett, and oak with a well-balanced Chardonnay influence. Tastes like it smells, but more tart, and with a nice lactobacillus presence. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and lively. Good stuff.

On tap at Side Project, pours a hazy gold with a white bubbly head, the aroma is fruits and sour at first with a kick of white wine notes, the flavor has a sour front end with a funky finish of wheat and wine, really nice bubbly light mouthfeel, could drink this all day.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2015, Blue Session - gold yellow coloured pour with a white head. Aroma and taste is medium sweet floral and fruity, some barnyard and bretty notes, grassy and floral nuances, light palate, dry finish. Very nice.

Draught @ CBC 2015 [ Blue Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, Denmark [ As Side Project Saison du Fermier ].Unclear medium golden yellow orange color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, fruity malt, straw, moderate yeasty, barnyard, sour wood, funky, grapes, wood, wine. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, funky, fruity, white wine - grapes, tart, dry. Refreshing. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150501]

huge thanks to Aaron for opening this gem, tons of wheat and wine flavors, very rustic and complex and fresh, Rustic and fresh is very challenging and this pulls it off. You get grapes, wheat, basement, berries, etc. Really impressive.

Saison du Fermier batch 2

Has an orange-yellow color with a decent, white head. 

Has aromas of crisp lemon peel, wet grass, soft hay and shreded unripe blood orange. This gets coated up by a mellow, slightly funky sourness, which leaves enough space on the palate for the fruits to unfold. The nose gets balanced by mellow, old dusty wood, exhibiting a well functioning melange.

Has a medium to lower carbonation, with a round mouthfeel to it, resulting in a dry, sour finish.

Tastes of earthy, wooden malts, together with leather and dough straw among flowery grass. Sour lemon peel is recognizable from the beginning until the very end, blending perfectly into the beers acidic, slightly funky tartness, resulting in a wooden, fruity dryness. Durings its finish, the beer offers an incredibly soft, minerals infused mouthfeel, together with juicy lemon and a fitting lactic acid. 

Ranges between an irresistable fruiti- and funkiness, creating a wonderful, complex taste. Both taste directions offer a decent range of well integrated flavors, which blend outstandingly soft together during the finish. In contrast to many other american sours, this features a very pleasant, not over the top sourness, which creates a wonderful interaction with the beers subtle, mellow fruitiness.

Poured from a Batch #3 bottle. 
Aroma is really nice with some light grain notes, medium citrus, medium light tropical and stone fruit and a light peppery note. Reminds me a lot of Saison Bernice but with some light oak. 
Pours a slightly hazy, yellow gold with a large, pillowy white head. Head exhibits nice retention as it slowly recedes into itself. Moderate lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is lightly to moderately tart with a nice lemon, citrus note. Light grain notes with medium bitterness. Light woodsy, peppery phenolic note. Medium light tropical and stone fruit with a light mineral quality. Light oak notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium to medium light bodied with nice carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, this is stupidly good and very similar to Bernice. It might be a slight bit tarter with a bit more lemon and less stone and tropical fruit. The oak adds some complexity, but also a bit of tannins.
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, blue session. Cloudy yellow body with a small white head. Floral, brett, acetic, fruity. Acetic finish. Great.

[5/1/15] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015. 2nd session. Cloudy golden. Lovely aroma, funky, earthy, a bit floral, fruity. Tart flavor, with funk and fresh fruits. Medium-bodied, lively carbonation. Great stuff.

Tap @ CBC 2015. Pours clear yellow with a medium white head. Aromas of gooseberries, white wine, citrus, peach, apples, pear, sweet esters, brett. Taste is tart and white vinous, lemon zest, sweet esters, brett, apples, woody dry notes. God damn smooth saison.

1st May 2015CBC Blue Session. Keg. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and crisp and semi dry. Lemony sourness. Smooth semi sweet malts even things out a bit. Light finish. Fine.

Draught at CBC 2015, blue session, with Ken, Colin, Reuben and Alex. Clear golfen beer with a small head. Fruity sourish perfume aroma, citrus, grapes, vinous, apples, caramel notes, some yeast. Yeasty perfume flavor, sourish, grapes, vinous notes, very good.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Blue session. Unclear golden orange color with white head. Yeasty aroma and citrusy fruity, funky bretty, barnyard notes, wood, light wineous. Light sweet, acidic, funky citrusy fruity and grassy taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Draught at CBC 2015.
Hazy golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of spices and white wine grapes.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of barnyard and grapes.
Tart finish.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is smooth fruity. Light citric and crisp. Sour. Mellow fruity and lingering citric finish.

Draught at CBC2015. Clear golden - white head. Crispy. Grapes. Wooden notes. Sweet and dry. Bretty. Light vanilla. Wooden. Nice notes of grapes. Lacto. Bretty. Lovely bretty. Light malty. Lovely. Yes please.
Tap @ CBC 2015, blue session. Hazy golden pour with a small fluffy head. Citrus, funk, some light estery notes and some vanilla. Nice oily texture. Really good stuff!

Tap @ CBC 2015. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of bretty funk, fruity sweet esters, pear, apples, weak wood and some citrus. The taste is tart and dry with white wine notes, lemon, funky brett, sweeter esters, grapes and apples. Very nice saison!

Bottle: Batch 2. Vibrant sunshine-yellow & straw colored body, cloudy to the point of full opacity with a sizable, chunky white head. Aroma is lovely tart & quite funky. Heavy vanilla yogurt & sour lacto yeast, damp hay, cheese rind, sweaty feet, lightly herbal grass, faint diaper, old horsey funk & modest barnyard must, tart green apple skin, stone fruits, a touch of white wine. Flavor is nice & tart as well. Very light, but still full of flavor. White wine, white grapes, tart lemon, green apple, hay, a touch of vinous wood & tannins, moldy cheese, sweat & horsey funk towards the finish. Aftertaste has lots of lingering lacto sourness, mineral water, stone fruit, & yogurt. Also some wafting cheese funk. Delicious stuff, Corey does it again.
Sample at cbc 2015. Poured hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of sweet and sour berries. Medium body, taste is, sour, tart, lightly sweet. Sour finish.
sample at cbc. pours cloudy light golden. Aroma is from barrel aging. taste is very sour, but light and refreshing.

Tap at CBC 2015. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma of light funk, white vinous notes, citrus, grapes and tart light fruits. Flavor is moderate to heavy sour. Light to light medium bodied with light carbonation.
At CBC. Poured hazy light amber with an off white head. Aroma of sweet and sour berries. Medium body, flavour is lightly sweet, moderately sour.
Batch 2. Tap @ CBC, 2015. Pours Hazy golden with a white head. Funk, straw and barnyard. Funky and fresh! Tart and really dry!

Pours hazy yellow low white head
Aromas of citrusy fruits, funk, green apples, hay
Taste has sweet and sour green apples, grapes, citrusy fruits
Pours cloudy amber with low white head. Aroma of apples, grapes, grass and bretta. Taste is rich tarty apple sour with mellow sour finish. Body is light and crisp with average carbonation.

Bottle, batch 2. Pours a cloudy glowing orange with small large-bubbled head that fades to a pretty ring of lacing. Aroma is musky melon, Tang, preserved lemon, mango juice, chalk, flowers, lavender, mild spice, well- integrated Brett. Taste is sour orange and mango, Sauvignon Blanc, moderate oak, candied lemon, slight grain, grass. Creamy texture with delicate carbonation is very appealing. Great stuff.

Bottle... Pours hazy and golden with a small, creamy, white head. The aroma is a mélange of juicy, citrus and fuzzy fruits, crackery malts, and a mild measure of yeast-driven spiciness. Medium-bodied with adequate carbonation. The flavor is tart, citric, fruity and bright with a lightly bready component. Finishes tart and tangy with mild, biscuity and tannic nuances. Bottle courtesy of landhoney!
Sampled during RBSG. From notes. Tart and funky with fruity and oaky notes.
Bottle. Pours orange with white head. Aroma is funky, saison yeast, pepper, citrus. Taste is light, refreshing, citrus, some funk. Another nice saison.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 [5/29, from notes]. 2014 bottle, again shared by Dice. Cloudy gold pineapple juice pour. Small white head. Smells beautiful. Brett, mineral, citrus, fruit. Damn, this smells fantastic. Gentle tartness, moderately sweet, juicy with minimal bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation, slick texture. Fantastic. 9/3/9/4/17   Entered 12/13/14. Batch 2 bottle, shared by Dice at a tasting (thanks!). Here are my awesome notes [why the hell dont I rate these live? No idea]. Hazy orange, no head. Bretty, pear juice, funk. Juicy, tart, fruity. Medium body, slick oily texture, short tart bite at the end. Nom Nom nom. 8/4/ [<--- literally, thats where my rating leaves off. Why are people even allowed to drink and rate, huh? Anyway, my gut and my amazing memory says 3.8.] 8/4/8/3/15

750mL bottle at a tasting. Cloudy golden beer with a small head. Its like a funk sour candy beer. It has sharp but not too sharp pear esters. That makes a sour, estery, and funky beer without the negatives of those aspects. Fun beer.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Yellow pour bright and sunny. Draft at side project. Bubbly and champagne like. Buttery and fruity. Good beer

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2015 750 bottle. (B2) Golden yellow, a ton of tart and sour, lemon citrus. Touch of white wine. Super clean sour without the acid.  11/23/15 4.2

750 B3 Forgot how truly amazing this beer is.  Lemon, tartness, soft barnyard.  I wish I could drink this stuff everyday.  5/18/15 4.3
Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Mild sour bouquet. Mildly sour citrus notes. Somewhat bitter hop undercurrents. A bit thin in the body. Good mouthfeel.
Bottle thanks to Chow. Pours a cloudy orange with small frothy white head. The aroma is lactic, tannic, and white grape. Thin mouthfeel with nice lacto, brett, tart, juicy, oak, very impressive.
Bottle at Perennial. Light orange pour with a small white head. Aroma is funky, hay, citrus. Fairly sweet. Absolutely awesome.

Hazed yellow/gold pour with frothy white head and lace. Aroma is hay, tart funk, and light citrus zest. Flavor is oaky, tart funk, citrus/lemon zesty finishing notes. Medium/light bodied with slightly aggressive carbonation. nice beer

Tasted on 2/8/14 from a 750mL bottle at the RBWG Grand Tasting, big thanks to phaleslu for this one! Pours hazy yellow with a thick white head that leaves average, messy lace. The nose is funky and brett nutty with some light bread malt, a touch of vinous oak, and plenty of lemon tartness. The flavor is more sour than I expected with plenty of lactic lemon, tons of brett funk, tart gooseberry, and the same vinous oak from the nose, very nicely balanced. The body is light and tannic with average carbonation and a long sour lemon finish.

Sample @ RBWG Grand Tasting. Soupy gold pour with a small head. Lemon meat, rustic yeast, mountain meadow. Taste is similar. A touch of pillowy, dry brett. Molding peaches. Wood. Light body, zippy. Very tasty.

Sampled at the RBSG 2014. It poured a dark golden color with a white head. The aroma was tart with hints of lemon, white wine and some funkiness. The taste was lemony with hints of yeast and some faint funkiness. Good stuff.

Draft @ the brewery. Pours a hazy golden pale orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty woody wine aroma. Fruity malty woody sour flavor. Has a fruity malty sour woody wine finish.

Full glass on draft during RBSG 2014 Bus Tour at Perennial. Hazy apricot yellow with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, tart fruit, floral notes, sweet fruit. Tastes of tart fruit, vinegar, tropical fruit, wine. Medium body with a dry finish. Low carbonation. Really nice.

Effervescent hazy gold. Puffy white 4head drops to good lacing, hazy island cap. Light citrus and brett tangerine nose, vegetal hops. Acidic flavor and light rubber, burns at front with minor white grape and citric notes, heavy burning across mid with light wood and vanilla, heavy sweetness through the juicy finish, tons of grape and acid, burning. Slick body, full with heavy carbonation that dominates, woody palate dominates with sweetness and acids.

Pour is slightly hazed golden orange with a fairly tight white head. Nose has a hint of oak, rubbery phenols, white grapes, faint farmhouse notes and some citrus. Taste follows suit, oaky up front with notes of the chard barrels. A hint of rubbery grapy phenol, tangerine fruitiness and some leathery brett. Body is light and creamy, with notes of acidity in the finish and some acetic burn.
At the brewery during SRBG Bus Tour 2014. Comes a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, funk, wine, and wood. Taste is lemon, wine, funk, oak, grass, and spice. Very good.

Sampled at a STL tasting - Pours hazy dull orange with a small white head,. The aroma has barnyard yeast, mild oak, some wine notes, hints of sourness and fall leaves. It has a medium frothy body with somewhat sharp carbonation. The flavor begins with lactic sourness, wine noes, some bugginess and lemons. The finish has some spiciness and pleasing funk. Excellent saison.

On tap @ Perennial. Hazed orange pour with a small white head. Bright citric acidity on the nose. Lemon, grapefruit, and white grape. Nice funk, some green apple, and yeast. Good crisp acidity to the flavor. Sour grape, green apple, and lemon. Lots of grapefruit as well. Subtle oak, some grass, and a hint of peach. Solid.

On draft at the brewery during RBSG 2014 Bus Tour. Lots of wine and citrus with a slight chest burning astringency. This hits more along the lines of a sour than a saison, so for that I like it, but for a saison, I think it is completely out of style. Enjoyable beer though.

This is a clear orange blond beer with a long lasting head. There is a good deal of complexity to the nose: lots of cloves, banana and floral notes. It has a light, soft texture which lets the fresh fruity notes really shine. The finish is dry which lends a great drinkability. Side project impresses me again and again with their beers.
Sampled at RBSG. Very hazy golden. A bretty funky floral nosevis nice. Mildly tart and plasticy bretty. Good. Floral with clover . Gentleness. Just right.
A delight to drink, and one of the best wine barrel saisons I?ve had the please to have. Intensely flavorful, and a joy to consume.

Bottle thanks to FX. Hazy gold pour super lacy white head. Aroma is super floral, light winey notes, mild citrusy, taste is light citrusy, winey, nice refreshing citric acidity, really juicy, really really tasty. Palate is med-light bodied with med carbonation, dry. Delicious stuff.

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by Fux, thanks! Hazy bright yellow/golden with a small persistent white head and good lacing. Aroma is fresh and enticing with a lot of citrus along brettanomyces, wine, yeast, lactic notes and pineapples. Taste is also super fresh with brettanomyces, citrus, pineapples, wine, yeast and a nice subtle but efficient malt backbone. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Slightly winey mouthfeel. Dry finish. Extremely drinkable/refreshing and really tasty. A super barrel-aged Saison that is definitely among the best. I loved it!

THX!!! to Fux. Gorgeous looking bottle. Hazy golden with a creamy white head. Nose is quite interesting mix of sweet white dough with lactic sourness, sweet white wine with funk, faint white chocolate, sweet, funky and quite a bit of wine. Taste is full of white grapes mixed with funk and heavy on the white wine oak plus funk, touch barnyard, Lactic touch is far smaller in the taste than in the nose. Lively full body. Quite an interesting and fun beer.

Thnx to fux ! 
Pours hazy blonde good white head 
Smell is oaky , brettfunk , buttery 
Taste is brett , funky , sour , butter/dough , wood , bit bitter , 
Good carbo . Sticky body . I like it

75cl, Batch 1, new exclusive American brew Anno 2013, with Brettanomyces, thx alot to Koen for sharing!, very complex brew, woody/fruity and slightly sour/vinous, balanced, cloudy, small head, very good brew

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of tartness, wine and light barrel notes, pale malts, lots of light fruits and oranges, and some light sour notes. Flavor the same with a cool blend of everything. Average texture. A really cool beer.
Bottle. Golden hazy pour with white head. Peach, lacto tart fruit aromas . Flavors follow, sweet peach, tart tones, Brett and lacto flavors.

Bottle courtesy of a recent Tampa Tasting. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is malt, lemon, citrus, oak, some mild vinegar, and some chardonnay character. Flavor is similar with malt, lemon, citrus, oak, chardonnay, vinous fruit, and tart/ lacto. Light to medium in body and enjoyable overall.
A very, very nice saison in the mold of TH Handfarm, with great light clean tartness and light grainy character. Very good stuff, would love to try again.

Many glasses on tap at West Lakeviews Zwanze 2013 event. Cant believe this didnt kick immediately. Really beautiful notes of lemon and light acidity. Some pineapple and white wine. Gorgeous mouthfeel. Outstanding.

Bottle sample at RBWG thanks to Peter. Pours a hazy straw golden color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have a bigger sour component than most saisons, nice tart fruit character, citrus and tropical, lactic, grass, funk, Brett character, some of the barrel notes. There is quite a bit going on here and I liked it.
Pours a hazy yellow with no head. Aroma of oak, citrus, funk. Taste is sour, white wine, oak and that good old Belgian funk.
Tasty saison shared by phales lou at rbwg. This was super funky and awesome. Some light sweetness but mainly funky brett and lacto with a light white wine presence. Delish. Thanks Peter!

[ Bottle ][ RBWG Asheville Grand Tasting ][ 750mL ][ Globe ][ Free ][ 2/8/14 ]
>> Thanks phaleslu for the share. Pours a low haze bright straw with fizzing out foam. Nose is peaches and cream, vanilla, Chardonnay barrel. Taste is prickly, quite sour like a peche lambic, pineapple juice. Bright and salty palate. More in the sour category than saison.

Bottle shared courtesy of JBPortland ! Pours a slightly hazy yellow golden color with a finger or two of fizzy white foam. The nose is spritzy lemon lime, with some lactic sourness and vinous complexity. The palate is bright and refreshing and follows the nose with great harmony of light rustic grain, sprite like lemon lime sweetness, round vanilla and tart vinous notes that fall into a heavy tartness late in the palate. A touch of acetic vinegar builds on the finish, but overall a delightful beer !

750ml bottle opens with a tiny gush, pours hazy orange with a finger of head. Nose is citrus, grains, earthy wood, tart. Taste is tart creamy citrus and grains, light brett, funk, peach, orange crush. Finish is dry tart lacto orange and lemony yogurt, some musty wine barrel notes. Great!

Sampled at 2014 RBWG. Yellow, with a small ring of foam. Pretty impressive - good mix of herbal, wine, lemon, and grass, all held together by a appealing tartness. Also some fresh bread flavors. More, please...

Bottle generously shared at the RBWG grand tasting. Hazy blonde pour. Nose of lemon and cooked banana. Nice flavor profile heavy of barnyard with moderate notes of lemon zest and passionfruit. Fairly lactic. Really nice!

Bottle from Phallus Lou. Pours slightly hazy golden. Aroma is stankin. Big tropical notes and funk. Taste is peppery, some more lactic tartness and citrus fruits. Plenty of oaky notes. Palate is slightly lively. Finishes acidic and oaky. Really solid beer. One of my favorites of RBWG.
Bottle - Nice and funky, barrel notes and citrus and grassy. Cloudy gold with. Decent white head. Tart lemon, grass and, lacy, Bret and activating my heartburn. Tart and awesome.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2014 Taster at RBWG 2014 grand tasting. Thanks to fail slew for sharing. Mmm! Awesome bigger sour taste, very satisfyingly sour. Mild sweet, light spiciness. Hazy golden orange color, thin white head, some loose dots of lace. Good lemony citrusy aroma. Floral, lightly estery saison notes. Medium body. Smooth, lightly soft, lighter carbonation. Very tasty sour saison. One of the best examples of this style Ive had, that was clear from the first sip. 8/3/9/4/17 Repeat rate on tap at the brewery during RBSG 6/21/14: Totally hazy amber orange color. Thin ring of white head. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Light slick. Bright. Moderate tart taste, light sweet. Very cool and refreshing. Mild belgian yeast, light spice, good citrusy fruity zesty aroma. Awesome tart spicy saison. Pretty assertive. 8/2/8/4/15 [Overall lowered 1pt]
Bottle @ RBWG. Pours a yellow appearance with a white head. Bright tropical fruits. Pineapple, guava, white wine. Pretty fucken dry and super juicy. Moderately sour. Fucken good.

Cloudy golden yellow with a good white head that leaves some nice lacing. Aroma is brett funk, green peppercorn, citrus peel, hint of cheese and white pepper. Medium-light bodied, smooth and well balanced palate with a touch of sourness. Delicious saison.

Bottle share. Thanks Jason. Batch 1, barrel 3234. Cloudy yellow-orange, airy cap settles to skiff. Aroma of spices, cheese, straw, attic, lemon and orange rind. Taste is tart, sweet, bitter. Medium-high carbonation, dry finish.

Bottle. Appearance - golden yellow color with a nice amount of white head. Aroma - Funk, Bready Malt. Taste - Tart with a lemon-like quality, nice breadiness, a bit sour with some earthy qualities to it. This is a beer I could drink all day long.

Crisp golden, hazy because it traveled pretty far. Soft white head that fades slowly. 
Nose is pretty fecal heavysulfur for sure. Sorry guys but nose is sulfuric. 
Thin, lemony and acidic. Its pretty soft, slightly tannic but lacks a real brightness that I personally look forward to in a saison. Lots of lemon and lime candies. very wheat heavy.

Bottle shared by Kyle, thanks! Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of sweet grains with a bit of light fruit and Belgian yeast with a touch of dry wine. Flavor has some citrus with light fruits, sweet grains and a bit of Belgian yeast/wine dryness.

Fobab 2013 Rate #11 Offered: 
Pours a hazy blonde with a good head and nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma offers a pretty serious funk with some nice wet limestone basement and some hay. 

The flavor offers a nice tartness and a mild sourness. Its got some fruity white grape flavors, some light peppery notes, and a bright but restrained hoppiness. 

Way cool, super chitl.
Lightly hazed yellowish/orange pour. White head. Man this is good! Stone fruit, wild grapes, yeast, plain yogurt, lacto sourness, lemons, tart and puckering, juicy and awesome.

On tap at FoBAB 2013 (Chicago, IL). Pours a nice brighter vibrant golden straw hue, mellow haze with a fluffy layer of bright white head. A thicker ring laces well, sticks around. Aromas are funky, some gentle pineapple meets cobwebs, bready malt, straw, horseblanket. Touches of oak, vanilla, and wood. Gentle spice. Cool, clean, mellow fruit. Initial is a bit tart, firmer pineapple and lemony element meets dry and funky brett, a nice sourness, gentle firmer brett oak as we move on. Bready, some straw, earth and florals. Nice mellow yeast quality grows. Some dough, estery fruit. More pineapple, some some dust, dry grainy straw, grass. Firmer fruit, nice stuff, good complexity, nice brett presence. This really offered a ton of elements late in the day. If anything, it was the most impressive of all the Side Project beers on the day, showing up the more assertive sours. Really saw this as a couple steps above Le Brettuer in the category (and which won Best of Show). Well done here. Really hoping to revisit at some point. Tasty and complex, really goes down easily.

favorite beer offered @ fobab! soft pear. creamed wheat. pleasant lemon yogurt sourness. soft chardonay oak. clean white grapes. pleasant musty fog funk. nice body. complex. approachable. pretty solid all round. reps offered.

Bottle thanks to Corey again... Pours same as the rest. Hazy golden straw hue with a. Creamy white head ... Lemony white wine tartness.
Clean with a bit of acidity... Flavors are more of the same with more if an intense lactic tartness but not overwhelming in any way. Lighter bodied with a mild effervescence. Splendid.
Fruity aroma. Straw color tiny white head. Tart citric and fruity. Great beer. At northdown.
Wow, delicious. Flavor and smell of stone fruit, brett, wine barrel and pepper yeast, well balanced, reminded me of a BA hill farmstead saison
Bottle. Pours apricot gold with white head. Nose and taste of wine, oak, stone fruit, saison yeast and lemon peel. Dry. Medium body.
Lighter saison and a wild fermented one. THe malt bill is very biscuity and there are hints of diacetyl.

Bottle. Pour is deep gold with a medium white head. Aroma is funky and tart with hints of lemon, white wine, and dry a champagne-like finish. Flavor is lemony tart up front with hints of wild yeast and very faint funk following. Finish is mixed malt and pepper with a little lingering tartness. Very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2014 Draft at Perennial for the Side Project release, served in a stemmed wine-style glass (roughly the same shape and size of those Goose Island glasses). Pours a cloudy bright gold color with a tiny white ring for a head. Aroma of farmhouse funk, lemon, herbs, grass, bready malts, oak, white wine, and spice. Flavor hits most of the same notes: wine, oak, bready malts, grass and herbs and spices, and a nice farmhouse-style funkiness throughout. Light-medium bodied, with a tart, funky mouthfeel and moderate to medium carbonation. So nice, bright, fresh, tart, and funky. A world-class saison.

Multiple pours at What the Funk!? Appearance is slightly hazy yellow with a big white head and good lacing. Big funky, bretty, pineapple, mango, light urine, biscuit, grassy, and doughy aroma. Taste is big lemon peel, doughy, citrus, brett, mango, a hint of black pepper with a medium sour finish. Light body with medium carbonation. Im a sucker for wine barrel aged saisons - love the brett addition, as well.
Thanks joet for this bubbly, hazy pour. Horseblanket note appears in aroma and builds throughout flavor. Dominated by acedic tartness . Refreshing dryness and light mouthfeel (hides the 7%abv).
Cloudy golden with big pillowy white foam. Tart very tart, bits of tangerine, citrus, creamy and spritzy. Emerging as it warms, cidery. Brett is rustic horseblanket. Tart finish.

Bottle and tap, multiple times. Served in a wine stem each time. P: Body is a nice, hazy pale orange with two fingers of white frothy head. Some lacing, and the head recedes to a nice film. S: Forward white wine and buttery oak, with some funk, eathy yeast, lemon rind, and light citrus. T: Tart lemons and citrus upfront, that quickly evolves into a vinous white wine. Toasted, buttery oak throughout. A nice dose of funk through the back half gives way to an abrupt dry, vinous finish. M: Nicely carbonated. Medium tartness, and juicy through the middle. Finish is bone dry. O: A delight to drink, and one of the best wine barrel saisons Ive had the please to have. Intensely flavorful, but a joy to drink.

Draft at LWW Zwanze Day event in Chicago. Pale yellow with thin head but lots of classic saison funk...very tasty

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 Sampled at Midwest Belgian Beer Festival. Pours a cloudy golden color with white head. Funky, yeasty, wet blanket aromas. Barnyard, cheese, yeasty flavors. Delicious beer. This was the standout beer at Midwest Belgian Beer Festival in my opinion.
